-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                                 Release Notes
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
In September 1971, thieves tunneled into the vault of a bank in London&#039;s Baker 
Street and looted safe deposit boxes of cash and jewelry worth over three 
million pounds. None of it was recovered. Nobody was ever arrested. The robbery 
made headlines for a few days and then disappeared - the result of a &#039;D&#039; Notice, 
gagging the press. This film reveals what was hidden for the first time. The 
story involves murder, corruption and a sex scandal with links to the Royal 
Family - a story in which the thieves were the most innocent people involved.

Director: Roger Donaldson

Writers : Dick Clement
        : Ian La Frenais
